Summary: Reposted: This time with all 3 photos (1st , 2nd, & 3rd) added!
trends: There have been 32 other sightings in London
There were 2 other sightings in London on or around October 11th 2008
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsi have decided to repost this report with all 3 photos: the first photo was taken directly after seeing it approach from the east end (heading westward), the second photo was taken when object was more centrally aligned with my balcony, the third photo was taken as it sped off in the west direction, fading out of sight. feel free to publicly scrutinize, validate, and\or analyse these photos. note: i have mass emailed several copies of the 3 "originals" to various friends, family members, and acquaintances, should anything (mysterious) suddenly happen to me. here is my original post: ***i went out to my balcony to have a cigarette (i only smoke outside), then all of a sudden i saw this enormous object with flashing red and amber (?) coloured lights coming in the direction of my apartment building at a speed that must have been 6-8 times faster than i have ever seen any plane move. i quickly grabbed my hp digital camera (which i keep on a shelf right in front of my balcony door) and i captured the first photo of it (the best visual one), then i was waiting for it to pass this tree outside of my balcony to take another photo, but it seemed to slow down its speed and was taking a long time, so i captured the second photo of it through the tree (2nd best visual), then i went to take the 3rd photo and my camera's l.e.d. display read "waiting for flash to recharge", so during this time the object seemed to really speed up again (i yelled out loudly "does anyone else see that?", in attempt to get any neighbors outside at the time to look up) and was almost out of sight, but i aimed the camera in its direction and captured the 3rd photo (the least visual one) anyways. i felt so "in awe" of its presence during the flyover, my heart was racing... this object looked like something straight out of a high-budget sci-fi movie, but it was real, and above my head in the open sky! it looked sort of like a "spiked orb", but i am not sure if the "spikes" were just a projection from the bright lights, or were actual "spikes" protruding from the "orb shaped" object. i was so excited, i had to light up another cigarette immediately after finishing the one i had smoked during the ufo sighting. i "uploaded the pictures" to my computer as soon as i awoke the next morning (today, sunday oct. 12th\2008), as i was too shaken and excited to do it before sleeping, and i didn't want to accidentally "delete" or "lose" them in my excited state. surprisingly, the "lights i had seen, didn't appear in either 3 of the photos, but the "orb shape" itself sure did! i am only going to upload the 2nd photo, the one with it partially obscured by the tree; but if anyone could steer me in the proper and secure method of submitting them for analysis (possibly at [u.w.o.] the university of western ontario?). this is a major event in my life, any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. i often take pictures of the sky during the day, cloud formations, chem-trails, and planes (ok, the squirrels & chipmunks playing in the tree beside my balcony too... cuz they are cute!), but that is why i keep my hp photosmart e327 5.0 megapixel camera beside my balcony door. it's not that great of a camera, but it was on sale and i am only a "beginner" (amateur) photographer. thanks to any (and all) that can lend any type of support.***
